abstract: Microsoft is opening the Xbox to independent developers. This raises the question about whether all sorts of set top boxes, such as Xbox, Tivo, Apple TV, could be open to applications that offer interactive television and information services as well as games.
snippet: Microsoft is opening the Xbox to independent developers. This raises the question about whether all sorts of set top boxes, such as Xbox, Tivo, Apple TV, could be open to applications that offer interactive television and information services as w...
lead_paragraph: The open season on openness has reached that most closed of societies: the video game console. Microsoft is now creating a method for almost anyone to write and sell games for its Xbox 360 machines.

headline.main: If Microsoft Opens the Xbox Is an App Store for Apple TV Next?

abstract: For a company that’s so brilliant at marketing, it seems to have absolutely no clue about crisis management.
snippet: For a company that’s so brilliant at marketing, it seems to have absolutely no clue about crisis management.
lead_paragraph: Two weeks ago, Apple launched MobileMe, the successor to its.Mac service, which costs $100 a year. Among other benefits, it can keep multiple Macs, PCs and iPhones in sync. E-mail, calendars and address books are wirelessly kept up to date. Very cool idea.

headline.kicker: From the Desk of David Pogue

abstract: Steve Ballmer is charging after Apple and Google, which mainly sell to individuals. He may be ignoring the best path to continued sucess for Microsoft, enterprise customers.
snippet: Steve Ballmer is charging after Apple and Google, which mainly sell to individuals. He may be ignoring the best path to continued sucess for Microsoft, enterprise customers.
lead_paragraph: Reading Steve Ballmer’s memo about the company’s strategy made me think that there is a bit of good news hidden in all those companies that don’t want to upgrade from Windows XP to Windows Vista.

headline.main: For Microsoft, There’s No Place Like Enterprise
